column4: how can i copy for example in data in /var to the this by terminal
to the os ubuntu
how can i copy for example in data in /var to the this by terminal
how can i copy for example in data in /var/ in other hardrive going to os ubuntu  the by terminal
your statement needs to be reworded, it isn't making much sense in english
the command you need is cp.  cp will copy files from one location to another.
I think I know what you mean
the command would be similar to sudo cp /mnt/"hard drive name" /var/data
you are on the right track.  have you mounted the hard drive?
what is the mount point?
it is probably mounted in /mnt or in /media .  can you check those directories to see if it is mounted there?
can you give me the full mount path?
you are correct.  the hard drive itself is listed in /dev, but it's not the same as the mount point
if it is mounted, the mount point will be listed below the huge grey bar
did you find it?
so you will need to do the command sudo cp /media/de360cd5-d197-41da-a0d5-fc548f92a45f/var/data /var/data
you may have to do sudo cp -r and then the command
the destination is your own /var/data, correct?
or are you just wanting to copy that folder from the 2nd hard drive, to some new location on your hard drive?
correct
yes.  I've only had to deal with .htaccess a few times, it was a pain
I can't really answer that.  All I did was google answers until i got it working :)
